Key Arguments: No person or entity should be exempt from the Misinformation and Disinformation Bill as everyone has the right to freedom of speech.
The Therapeutics Goods Authority (TGA) is accused of being a source of misinformation by omitting large amounts of relevant data from public discourse.
The submission criticizes the TGA for under-reporting the side effects of Pfizer's Comirnaty vaccine, suggesting that the public was not fully informed.
The author argues that if the TGA and other authorities can spread misinformation, then no one should be exempt from the Bill.
The submission emphasizes that freedom of speech is a fundamental right and should not be restricted by legislation.
Notable Quotes: All people and entities must be allowed to share their knowledge.
How was this ever seen as a process of full 'informed consent'?
Freedom of speech is not a plaything for bureaucrats or vested interest to try and control.
There must be NO exemptions for any one group. Everyone is exempt or no-one.
